step.context: \text{If the vector cross product }\ora{b}\times\ora{a}=\ora{c}, \\ \text{are the following true about $\ora{c}$ ?}
step.tex: \text{$\ora{c}$ is $\perp$ to the plane containing $\ora{a}$ and $\ora{b}$.}
\text{$\ora{c}$ lies in the plane containing $\ora{a}$ and $\ora{b}$.}
step.reason: \text{As suggested by the Right-Hand rule, the} \\ \text{cross-product of two non-zero vectors is}\\ \text{a vector which is perpendicular to the plane} \\ \text{containing the original two vectors.}
